title: The Masterpiece of the Month: Stoke-by-Nayland by John Constable, W. W. Kimball Collection
description: During April 1940, John Constable’s “Stoke-by-Nayland” was featured as the Masterpiece of the Month. The 19th century English landscape painter’s ability to utilize color and expressive palette knife and brush strokes to emulate the vibrancy of a landscape was praised during and after his life, inspiring many French painters, namely, Eugène Delacroix. According to the newsletter announcing this exhibition, apparently Delacroix was so impressed by Constable’s work he repainted one of his own works in the style of Constable.

input: The Masterpiece of the Month: Stoke-by-Nayland by John Constable, W. W. Kimball Collection
